topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Alpha: Configuring the KVM Region Hosts

p.i: Return to the Installing the KVM + ESX Deployment.

body.p: After deploying the KVM region, you must perform the following steps to configure the

ol.li: Log into the KVM region controller-0.
Copy cakey.pem file, the region_config file, and latest license file (HCG_2.0_WR_license.lic.txt) to KVM region controller-0.
Edit region_config file per instructions listed in HCG-287 JIRA. Additional to JIRA instructions,
Update region name under [shared services] to memphis in place of regionone.

Execute the following command:
sudo config_region

Execute the following command to associate controller-1 and the compute nodes with controller-0:system host-add --hostname controller-1 --personality controller --mgmt_mac <mgmt_mac> --bm_mac <bm_mac> --bm_ip <ilo_ip> --bm_type ilo4 --bm_username <ilo_user> --bm_password <ilo_password> system host-add --hostname <unique-compute-name> --personality compute --mgmt_mac <mgmt_mac> --mgmt_ip <mgmt_ip> --bm_mac <ilo_mac> --bm_ip <ilo_ip> --bm_type ilo4 --bm_username <ilo_user> --bm_password <ilo_password>

After the controller-1 and the compute nodes come up successfully after PXE boot, execute the following commands from controller-0 to unlock the compute nodes:
Create the Infra interface: system host-if-add –V <bls/infra VLAN ID> –nt infra <compute-0> infra vlan pxeboot0
Add an IP address to the interface: system host-addr-add <compute-0> infra 10.X.X.X 24
Configure the interface: system host-if-modify <compute-0> -n vrs -nt data-vrs --ipv4-mode=static ethX (interface on which untagged TUL is presented)
Add an IPv4 or IPv6 address to the interface: system host-addr-add <compute-0> vrs 10.X.X.X 24
Update the host: system host-update <compute-0> vsc_controllers=10.X.X.X,10.X.X.X [VSC controller IP’s]
Unlock the host: system host-unlock <compute-0>
Example commands:system host-if-add –V 722 –nt infra 3 infra vlan pxeboot0 system host-addr-add 3 infra 10.70.22.81 24 system host-if-modify 3 -n vrs -nt data-vrs --ipv4-mode=static eth4 system host-addr-add 3 vrs 10.70.5.83 24 system host-update 3 vsc_controllers=10.70.5.31,10.70.5.32 system host-unlock 3

In addition to above set of commands, please apply the below work around on controller-0 (active controller) in order to ensure instance launching succeeds. Repeat the commands for each compute node. source /etc/nova/openrc nova aggregate-create remote_storage_hosts nova aggregate-set-metadata remote_storage_hosts localstorage=false nova aggregate-add-host remote_storage_hosts <compute host name>
